title: Wise — International Money Without the Bank Markup
summary: Send money abroad at the real exchange rate. Hold 40+ currencies. Get local bank details in multiple countries.
content:
Wise (formerly TransferWise) solves the hidden fee problem with international money transfers. Banks typically mark up exchange rates by 3-5% on top of their transfer fees. Wise uses the mid-market rate — the real one you see on Google — and charges a small, transparent fee upfront. For a $1,000 transfer, you might save $30-50 compared to a traditional bank.

The multi-currency account is where it gets powerful. You get local bank details in USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, and more — meaning you can receive payments like a local in those countries. Freelancers and remote workers use this to avoid conversion fees entirely by invoicing in the client's currency.

The debit card spends in any currency at the real exchange rate, making it the best travel card for most people. Auto-conversions let you set target rates and convert automatically when the market hits your number.
frictionNote: Identity verification required (standard KYC). Some countries have limited features. Large transfers may take 1-2 business days.
